meanings.definition: To surpass in reasoning or argument.
meanings.sent1: She always manages to outreason her opponents in debates.
meanings.sent2: He tried to outreason his friend's excuses for being late.
meanings.sent3: The clever student outreasoned the tricky math problem.
meanings.sent4: Her logical thinking outreasoned any doubts in the group.
meanings.sent5: The detective's deduction skills could outreason any criminal's plan.

meanings.definition: To use reasoning to overcome or defeat someone or something.
meanings.sent1: The team had to outreason their opponents to win the game.
meanings.sent2: She outreasoned her fear of heights by focusing on the beautiful view.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to outreason the closed door blocking its way.
meanings.sent4: His determination to succeed outreasoned any obstacles in his path.
meanings.sent5: The explorer's curiosity outreasoned his fear of the unknown.
